hypothesis_content.title: Stress Regime Catalyst Triggers Amplified Flight to Liquidity & Stables
hypothesis_content.statement: In a STRESS market regime, any negative price catalyst (e.g., a sharp 5% BTC drop within 1 hour) will trigger an amplified and accelerated sell-off in mid-cap altcoins (rank 20-100) relative to large caps, as liquidity collapses, creating alpha via a short altcoin/long BTC pair trade.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In stress regimes, liquidity is fragile. A sharp catalyst triggers panic and a non-linear scramble for the exit. Liquidity evaporates faster in less liquid mid-cap alts than in BTC, causing their prices to drop precipitously relative to BTC. This is a pure liquidity amplification effect.
entry_conditions: Catalyst: BTC drops >=5% within a 1-hour candle.
Enter when the Mid-Cap Altcoin Index (e.g., INDEX: MIDCAP) 15-minute RSI(14) crosses below 40 on the same candle or the next. Position: Short INDEX: MIDCAP / Long BTC (equal USD notional).

exit_conditions.take_profit: Close when the pair ratio (MIDCAP/BTC) declines by 4%.
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Close if the pair ratio increases by 2%.

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Following the catalyst in a STRESS regime, the Mid-Cap/BTC ratio does not decrease, or BTC underperforms mid-caps.
